bill_title: revise certain provisions related to enrollment and attendance by secondary school students in postsecondary courses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to enrollment and attendance by secondary school students in postsecondary courses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-28-37 be amended to read as follows: 13-28-37. Any secondary school student in grades eleven and twelve who is admitted to an institution of higher education or a postsecondary vocational education institution as a special student may enroll in not more than two courses per fall or spring semester, which are offered at the institution of higher education or postsecondary vocational education institution. The student shall obtain the school district's approval of the postsecondary course prior to enrolling in the course. If approved, the The secondary school in which the student is enrolled shall excuse the student for attendance at the postsecondary course or courses, and the student shall receive full credit toward high school graduation as well as postsecondary credit for successful completion of the postsecondary course. The student shall notify the secondary school of attendance at the postsecondary course and shall provide documentation to the secondary school verifying enrollment in the postsecondary course. The resident school district may pay all or part of the tuition and fees for a course approved for credit toward high school graduation in accordance with this section. The student is responsible for any tuition and fees not paid by the resident school district and for any other costs involved with attending a postsecondary institution. If a failing grade is received in a postsecondary course under this section, the student receiving the failure is no longer eligible to enroll for postsecondary courses under this section.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to enrollment and attendance by secondary school students in postsecondary courses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-28-37 be amended to read as follows: 13-28-37. Any secondary school student in grades eleven and twelve who is admitted to an institution of higher education or a postsecondary vocational education institution as a special student may enroll in not more than two courses per fall or spring semester, which are offered at the institution of higher education or postsecondary vocational education institution. The student shall obtain the school district's approval of the postsecondary course prior to enrolling in the course. If approved, the The secondary school in which the student is enrolled shall excuse the student for attendance at the postsecondary course or courses, and the student shall receive full credit toward high school graduation as well as postsecondary credit for successful completion of the postsecondary course. The student shall notify the secondary school of attendance at the postsecondary course and shall provide documentation to the secondary school verifying enrollment in the postsecondary course. The resident school district may pay all or part of the tuition and fees for a course approved for credit toward high school graduation in accordance with this section. The student is responsible for any tuition and fees not paid by the resident school district and for any other costs involved with attending a postsecondary institution. If a failing grade is received in a postsecondary course under this section by a student in grade nine or ten , the student receiving the failure is no longer eligible to enroll for postsecondary courses under this section until grade eleven or twelve. If a student in grade eleven or twelve fails a postsecondary course under this section, the student receiving the failure is no longer eligible to enroll for postsecondary courses under this section .
